action.action-desc: Mr. Armstrong (for himself and Ms. Velázquez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources, and in addition to the Committee on Agriculture, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture to develop a plan for providing the staffing necessary to ensure timely review of communications use authorizations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Enhancing Administrative Reviews for Broadband Deployment Act.

section.header: Ensuring timely review of communications use authorizations

paragraph.text: The Secretaries concerned shall each conduct, with respect to the relevant covered department, a study to determine—

subparagraph.text: if there are programmatic or administrative barriers to the timely review of requests for communications use authorizations;
if there are revisions to rules or regulations that could be implemented to improve efficiency with respect to reviewing requests for communications use authorizations; and
if there are processes for prioritizing the review of requests for communications use authorizations.

paragraph.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretaries concerned shall jointly submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report that—

subparagraph.text: describes the results of the studies conducted under paragraph (1), including any barriers, revisions, or processes identified under subparagraphs (A) through (C) of such paragraph; and
includes a plan for providing, with respect to the organizational units of the relevant covered departments, the staffing necessary to ensure timely review of communications use authorizations.

paragraph.text: The term appropriate congressional committees means—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives;
the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives;
the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate; and
the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate.

paragraph.text: The term communications facility has the meaning given the term communications facility installation in section 6409(d) of the Middle Class Tax Relief and Job Creation Act of 2012 (47 U.S.C. 1455(d)).
The term communications use means the placement and operation of a communications facility.
The term communications use authorization means an easement, right-of-way, lease, license, or other authorization—

subparagraph.text: provided by the Secretary of the Interior or the Secretary of Agriculture;
to locate or modify a communications facility on covered land; and
for the primary purpose of authorizing the occupancy and use of such covered land for communications use.
public lands; and
National Forest System land.

paragraph.text: The term National Forest System has the meaning given that term in section 11(a) of the Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974 (16 U.S.C. 1609(a)).

subparagraph.text: with respect to the Department of the Interior—

clause.text: a State office of the Bureau of Land Management;
a regional office of the Bureau of Land Management;
a district office of the Bureau of Land Management; or
a field office of the Bureau of Land Management; and

subparagraph.text: with respect to the Department of Agriculture—

clause.text: a regional office of the Forest Service;
a management unit of the Forest Service; or
a ranger district office of the Forest Service.

paragraph.text: The term public lands has the meaning given that term in section 103 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43 U.S.C. 1702).
The term relevant covered department means—

subparagraph.text: with respect to the Secretary of the Interior, the Department of the Interior; and
with respect to the Secretary of Agriculture, the Department of Agriculture.
the Secretary of the Interior; and
the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service.
